text: Joshua Walter McGeough Bond (1831 – 29 August 1905) was an Irish Conservative Party politician. Bond was elected Conservative Member of Parliament (MP) for Armagh City at a by-election in 1855—caused by the death of Ross Stephenson Moore—but was then defeated by Stearne Miller at the next election. Although he regained the seat in 1859, he only held it for one term before retiring from the race in 1865. ==References== ==External links== * Category:1831 births Category:1905 deaths Category:Irish Conservative Party MPs Category:Members of the Parliament of the United Kingdom for County Armagh constituencies (1801–1922) Category:UK MPs 1852–1857 Category:UK MPs 1859–1865
title: Joshua Bond
